previewArticle.title: Sporting Kansas City vs. New England Revolution | MLS Match Preview

recapArticle.title: Sporting Kansas City 2, New England Revolution 3 | MLS Match Recap

timelineItems.desc: The Revolution and Sporting KC are underway at Sporting Park.
timelineItems.title: KICKOFF: Sporting Kansas City vs. New England Revolution

timelineItems.comment: First Half begins.
Daigo Kobayashi (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Jorge Claros (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: biag
timelineItems.text: Jay Heaps "Tell me what the difference was" Need more of these audios. #MLS #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Heath Markley
timelineItems.text: Blake's first #SportingKC game

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: I love that Jermaine Jones pushes the Revs to get the ball forward. Shuttleworth loves to take his time in back #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box is close, but misses to the right. Assisted by Kelyn Rowe.
Attempt missed. Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is just a bit too high.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Rowe with a perfect ball to Feilhaber, but he shoots high. Otherwise, you'd have to call that an own-assist.

timelineItems.comment: Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the left wing.
Foul by Paulo Nagamura (Sporting Kansas City).
Attempt missed. Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box misses to the left.

timelineItems.name: Alexi Lalas
timelineItems.text: Jay Heaps continues to try to make sense of a senseless world. He's like the old man on the cover of Led Zeppelin IV. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Conor Frederick
timelineItems.text: Bad news- #NERevs can't string 3 passes together in the final third. Good news - #SKC can't either.

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution).
Paulo Nagamura (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: ⓚⓐⓡⓐ ⓦⓐⓝⓣⓛⓘⓝⓖ
timelineItems.text: GO SPORTING!!!! #sportingkc

timelineItems.name: Stupid Ass Dustin
timelineItems.text: GAMEDAY SELFIE #sportingkc #Instagram http://t.co/nIkRNxOuRf

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City).
Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.

timelineItems.name: Amy Worley
timelineItems.text: After a stressful week, I was looking forward to relaxing in front of the #SportingKC game tonight. THIS IS NOT RELAXING.

timelineItems.name: Total MLS
timelineItems.text: Really liked Rowe's game at UCLA. Watching him blossom into a professional has been fun. He's got such good instincts. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Dustin Rimmey
timelineItems.text: At starting center for your Los Angeles Lakers #kronberg #sportingkc http://t.co/RbhTcyZUoX

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: For the first time in a long time (ever?) #NERevs dont look overwhelmed in first 18 mins

timelineItems.name: Nick Chávez
timelineItems.text: .@SportingKC's supporter section drummer is absolutely shredding out there. I'm hearing hardcore breakdowns and everything. #SportingKC #MLS

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Friday Night Lights. #SKCvNE http://t.co/qkIMBiEEqE

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) left footed shot from a difficult angle on the left is high and wide to the left. Assisted by Dominic Dwyer with a cross.
Match ends, Sporting Kansas City 2, New England Revolution 3.

timelineItems.name: Nelson Vasconcelos
timelineItems.text: #3points #NERevs #SexyFootball

timelineItems.name: Kyle Garrett
timelineItems.text: #NERevs http://t.co/e9W9xCpVnU

timelineItems.name: Miki Turner
timelineItems.text: That was a highly entertaining game. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Ryan Lanigan
timelineItems.text: Have to give Shuttleworth credit for the three big saves between the 60th and 70th minutes. They weren't pretty, but effective. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones' first MLS goal was a stunner. And the game-winner: http://t.co/tlsWKtzqpq #SKCvNE http://t.co/VVdnpDe5V3

timelineItems.name: Kyle McCarthy
timelineItems.text: New England moves into second place in the Eastern Conference on tiebreakers after 3-2 victory at Sporting Kansas City. #MLS #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Taylor Twellman
timelineItems.text: Huge win for @NERevolution and big goal from @Jermainejunior has them chasing @dcunited for the Eastern Conference top seed. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.desc: A massive clash atop the Eastern Conference is ahead when Sporting Kansas City play host to the New England Revolution on Friday evening at Sporting Park.
timelineItems.title: HIGHLIGHTS: Sporting Kansas City vs. New England Revolution | September 26, 2014

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Here's the Jermaine Jones goal from distance that brought #NERevs up to 2nd in the East: http://t.co/PB5cBbgk52 #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Late Jones winner sees #NERevs pick up 6th W in 7 games. HIGHLIGHTS: http://t.co/k82tnKhiCo #SKCvNE http://t.co/2SuPBiG6Tm

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  Sporting Kansas City 0, New England Revolution 1. Kelyn Rowe (New England Revolution) left footed shot from a difficult angle on the left.

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: NASA is now tracking Zusi's shot.... #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Who knew Dwyer could deliver a ball like that? Zusi had a great chance there #NERevs

timelineItems.text: GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOL de #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Christopher Brown

timelineItems.text: Rowe Rowe Rowe your boat. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: That cross came from Kevin Alston. Perfect ball on a great overlap. Just a great bit of soccer right there #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Lisa Nelson
timelineItems.text: Rowe, Rowe, Rowe your boat! Gooooal! #NERevs

timelineItems.name: étienne rädler
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones w/ a very Arjen Robben approach to drawing a foul #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Matthew Doyle
timelineItems.text: Over the last 3 months @SportingKC have only one shutout, and it was against Chivas. So it doesn't really count. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) right footed shot from the centre of the box is close, but misses the top right corner. Assisted by Lee Nguyen with a through ball.

timelineItems.name: Neil Caswell
timelineItems.text: If you didn't know and turned on this match you might think this could be Europa league or at least European football. #MLS #NERevs #SKC

timelineItems.name: Justin Churchill
timelineItems.text: Davies needs to use his left foot there #NERevs #MLS

timelineItems.text: Sporting game with Blue #sportingKC

timelineItems.name: OptaJack
timelineItems.text: 1 - @NERevolution have allowed just one goal in their two previous meetings with SKC in #MLS 2014, scoring five themselves. Working. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Kevin Alston.

timelineItems.name: A Real Jam-Up Guy
timelineItems.text: One of Charlie Davies' legs is 1.5 inches shorter than the other and now I can't stop imagining him hobbling around in a circle. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.text: @ssinovic if you forget to mark @TealBunB one more time, we're breaking up. 💔 #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: I find it weird that the sideline referee has some color in his cleats. Feel like they should just be black #NEREVS

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Andrew Farrell.

timelineItems.name: Henry Hauck
timelineItems.text: Kevin Ellis with the spin move/cross field ball combo. Certainly taught by Collin. #AC78 #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: That is one hell of a defensive play by Farrell to get in front of that shot. His speed and timing were perfect on that one #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Mad Bora
timelineItems.text: Kevin Alston is putting David Luiz's Sideshow Bob haircut to shame. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Flying Scotsman
timelineItems.text: This game is pretty intense. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: Farrell just looks so much more confident at CB than he has at RB in last few weeks

timelineItems.name: BENJ…[ LOADING ]
timelineItems.text: JOSE! JOSE, JOSE JOSE JOSE!!!!!!!! #NEREVS

timelineItems.name: NE Revolution
timelineItems.text: JOSE!!! You kidding me?! #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: JOSE! GOAL! My goodness the captain makes a run the length of the field and hammers one home. What a great play by Goncalves! #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Nelson Vasconcelos
timelineItems.text: YOU DON’T GIVE JOSÉ GONÇALVES THAT KIND OF SPACE #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Josie Becker
timelineItems.text: Box to box center back play for a bottom corner goal? Someone needs to adjust the FIFA 15 sliders #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Rojuan
timelineItems.text: Lol. Dreadful defending by Sporting KC. No one closing him down. Goncalves makes it 2-0 to the #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Ryan Brister
timelineItems.text: The #NERevs do not look like a team that went on an 8-game losing streak just a couple of months ago.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Revs are getting beat bad on the ball early. Need to be stronger in possession #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Richard Slate
timelineItems.text: Great stat: Revs are 12-0-0 when they score 2+ goals this season & 1-13-3 when they score 1 or less #Revolution #MLS #SportingKC

Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the right wing.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Kronberg does a good job to get a hand on that one. Tierney with a really good free kick. Revs almost had 3 #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Abbey Thelin
timelineItems.text: It almost sounds like #SportingKC supporters are chanting "ohhhhhh Lee Nguyen" #MVLee

timelineItems.name: Sarah Lerner
timelineItems.text: 8 goals conceded in #SportingKC's last 3 home games. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 44' Good movement from SKC down the left sideline between Sinovic and Zusi. Cross field ball to Dovale is headed out. SKC throw-in. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Teal Bunbury (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: Joshua Kakluskas
timelineItems.text: Defense is holding strong so far. Gotta keep alert though, SKC has too many playmakers to not make this game a nervous wreck. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Thats the half. What a half for the Revs! They take the 2-0 lead into the hale behind the Rowe and Goncalves goals #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: First Half ends, Sporting Kansas City 0, New England Revolution 2.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: 3 shots on target, 2 goals. #NERevs lead 2-0 on the road at HT: http://t.co/IqOe2PF2ql #SKCvNE http://t.co/OhS5XzCfwY

timelineItems.name: Matt Kirschner
timelineItems.text: Floored by what I saw in the first half from #SKC. So much talent, but the #Revs are dominating every facet of this game. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: aerphoto
timelineItems.text: #sportingkc - we gotta first timer here!

timelineItems.name: Will Northrup
timelineItems.text: Changes? Daigo's yellow worries me. Tough play so far. I'd bring Caldwell in early. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Sean Curry
timelineItems.text: Kroneberg terrible in 1st half. At least partly to blame on both goals. Wandering off his line. Gruenebaum more reliable #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Total MLS
timelineItems.text: What was Besler pointing at on Goncalves' goal? Like Vermes said, he's got to stop ball there. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Deadlock Victim ✡
timelineItems.text: 0-2 on 63-37% possession? Nice! #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Thomas Floyd
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones has been a nice addition, but this #NERevs turnaround has been about Kelyn Rowe being healthy and effective.

timelineItems.comment: Second Half begins Sporting Kansas City 0, New England Revolution 2.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sporting have 45 minutes to sort themselves and save a point.

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) because of an injury.

timelineItems.name: Jennifer P
timelineItems.text: 2-0...most dangerous score in fútbol. #SKCvNE @NBCSN @mls

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: That hurts. Zusi took a shoulder right in the side of the head from Rowe. Inadvertent but a hard hit #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: .@Krowe210 made it look easy: http://t.co/cllbHJdN1b #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: biag
timelineItems.text: Fortunate Zusi didn't suffer a head injury with that elbow to the head #MLS #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Thomas Offen
timelineItems.text: Even Al Pacino was like "That was a little hammy, bro." #NERevs #StopTheFlops

timelineItems.text: 4' CLOSE from Dwyer! He curls a free kick around the Revolution wall and it's inches wide of Shuttleworth's righthand post! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.text: Besler has been absolute trash ever since tripping on Lukaku's foot. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.text: GOAL Sporting KC. Excellent timing (and shot) from Nagamura pulls the home team within one. 2-1, 55th minute. #SportingKC

timelineItems.text: Good finish by Nagamura and SKC are back in this one. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Nagamura just busted out of the phone booth with a cape on. and it 's 2-1 now.

timelineItems.name: Jacob Warneke
timelineItems.text: Dom #TieGame #SKC

timelineItems.text: Those last 2 goals were mental #nerevs

timelineItems.name: Steven Rodriguez
timelineItems.text: YEAH!!!! IT HAPPENS THAT FAST!  #SportingKc #GoSKC 2-2!!!! Lets go!

timelineItems.name: Vicki Rogers
timelineItems.text: Let's have all remaining goals in front of @KCCauldron #SKCvNE #IBTWWW

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Dovale curled a diagonal pass to Nagamura, who lobbed it back across the face of goal and Dwyer stabbed home from two yards out! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Alexi Lalas
timelineItems.text: Ciudad de Kansas! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: .@SportingKC (13-10-6, 48 pts) is 2nd in the East, 3 pts behind @dcunited. @NERevolution not far behind in 3rd (13-13-3, 42 pts). #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Hunter Farrell
timelineItems.text: #NERevs warmup at Kansas City's Sporting Park. #Feelthewin GO REVS! http://t.co/7oBV3ePSvq

timelineItems.text: Warming up!! #SportingKC http://t.co/gz2b9Rmvqo

timelineItems.name: Alex DeJong
timelineItems.text: Looks like I'm the closest things the #NERevs have to traveling support and I'm currently wearing a Zusi jersey in the south stand #sorry

timelineItems.name: Anthony
timelineItems.text: Another Sporting KC game! #SKC #sporting #soccer #mls

timelineItems.name: Amy Sword
timelineItems.text: Great night for #SKC GO #sporting

timelineItems.name: Hannah
timelineItems.text: @gzusi and @Jermainejunior on the same field tonight, this is going to be good! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: NE has earned two home wins over @SportingKC this season: 2-0 on 4/26 and 3-1 on 9/3. NE hasn’t swept KC in reg. season since 1999. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Christopher Brown
timelineItems.text: It's a bit of cliche, but I'm not sure I can remember a recent #NERevs game that had this much playoff implications and atmosphere!

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: High intensity from #SportingKC so far. How long can they keep it up considering their busy schedule? #NERevs

timelineItems.text: Pretty sure Jesus is a Sporting KC fan! #SportingKC http://t.co/ZncVSgL06F

timelineItems.text: The quiet before the storm #sportingkc

timelineItems.name: Matt Kirschner
timelineItems.text: Oh boy. @SportingKC vs. @NERevolution tonight. @Jermainejunior is back for the Revs. Expect fireworks, folks. Can't wait! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.text: .@Ekronberg and @b_shuttle are tied for fourth in @MLS with seven clean sheets this season. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.text: #sportingkc with Big Red. WE BELIEVE!!!

timelineItems.name: Joshua Kakluskas
timelineItems.text: Now we're gonna be stagnant for the rest of the game and SKC is gonna get a winner within the next 10 minutes. Can already see it. #NERevs

timelineItems.text: Am I the only one who loves Farrell in the middle? I am a big AJ fan but think Farrell is at his best at CB #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: Minutes away from kickoff on NBCSN! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Fans still streaming into Sporting Park. It's going to be a loud one tonight, with all that's on the line.

timelineItems.name: Lindsey
timelineItems.text: In two hours Sporting KC will either be in first place or fall to 3rd. Let's go #SKC!

timelineItems.text: Did... Did Zusi just kick the ball at the AR? And get nothing for it. Fair. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Sherry Liu
timelineItems.text: #confetti in my drink...no worries it means we #scored #sportingkc #ohyeah

timelineItems.name: Fountain City Ultras
timelineItems.text: Absolutly MENTAL right now at Sporting Park. #SKCvNE #ultras #nopyronoparty http://t.co/pozPZeiy5x

timelineItems.name: Justin Mouzoukos
timelineItems.text: Best fans on earth #sportingkc @MattMonge http://t.co/VxTlCgDJtt

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: Just a few moments to kickoff here @SportingPark. The hosts don their traditional primary kits, Revs in navy shirts and white shorts #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Mike Toole
timelineItems.text: Man, @Jermainejunior just gave that feedback-laced anthem the DEFINITION of "sideeye" #NERevs #SKCvNE http://t.co/g7t5s9tvub

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Lots of smoke still in Sporting Park. Usually you don't see that much smoke in one space w/o "The Wall" and a box of Crunchberries involved.

timelineItems.comment: Lineups are announced and players are warming up.
Attempt saved. Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the centre of the goal. Assisted by Soony Saad.
Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Graham Zusi tries a through ball, but Dominic Dwyer is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Justin Churchill
timelineItems.text: Heaps looking to sure up the midfield. Jones looks tired, gonna come out #NERevs

timelineItems.name: BENJ…[ LOADING ]
timelineItems.text: If any team is affected by momentum, it's the #NERevs. So good when they're good, but they start letting in goals and…

timelineItems.comment: Attempt missed. Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box misses to the left. Assisted by Dominic Dwyer.

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Glad that Caldwell is coming on for Daigo instead of Jones #NEREVS

timelineItems.name: Justin Churchill
timelineItems.text: I thought Jones should have came out, not sure if I agree with the sub from an #NERevs standpoint.

timelineItems.name: Daniel Holt
timelineItems.text: Nice sub for New England. It allows Jones to play closer to a #8 than #6. Caldwell is like the Revolution's Beckerman, in that way. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by José Gonçalves.
Attempt saved. Paulo Nagamura (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the top centre of the goal.

timelineItems.name: Mo
timelineItems.text: Would have to think Jones comes out soon. Doesn't look right #NERevs

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 67' Naga's blistering volley is palmed away by Shuttleworth! That had some venom on it! SKC corner now, @KCCauldron in full voice! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Hans Guthrie
timelineItems.text: Benny! Channeling your inner Espinoza there! Activate #BEASTMODE #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the centre of the goal.

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: #NERevs under heavy fire. Gotta find a way to turn the tide.

timelineItems.name: Katie Mattaini
timelineItems.text: Two HUGE saves by Bobby! #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Kevin Ellis (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box is blocked. Assisted by Benny Feilhaber with a cross.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Paulo Nagamura kickstarting the @SportingKC comeback effort: http://t.co/jiNCBPj33F #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by José Gonçalves.
Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Teal Bunbury.

timelineItems.name: cushicushi
timelineItems.text: Shots! Shots! Shots! #sportingkc

timelineItems.name: Mad Bora
timelineItems.text: I like Claros growing into that holding spot and Paulo has brought it in the second half. Right trio in the middle, I think. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Igor Julião tries a through ball, but Graham Zusi is caught offside.
Attempt blocked. Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked.
Offside, New England Revolution. Kelyn Rowe tries a through ball, but Jermaine Jones is caught offside.

timelineItems.desc: Daigo Kobayashi (New England Revolution) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Daigo Kobayashi gets caught horse-collaring Benny Feilhaber

timelineItems.comment: Benny Feilhaber (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Foul by Daigo Kobayashi (New England Revolution).

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 7' Davis curls in a cross from the left wing and Besler's firm header clears. Jermaine Jones flagged offside seconds later. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Attempt saved. Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box is saved in the top centre of the goal. Assisted by Scott Caldwell.

timelineItems.name: Greg Wallace
timelineItems.text: I Love MLS #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Conor Frederick
timelineItems.text: Bobby Shuttleworth keeps bailing us out. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Dan Clarke
timelineItems.text: My goodness. What an onslaught. I have no idea how #SKC didn't get #3 there #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Chloe Weishaar
timelineItems.text: This game has my heart racing #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Nick Chávez
timelineItems.text: Ayo, this Sporting Kansas City v. New England Revolution game is a slobber knocker. Crackin. On NBC Sports Network NOW. #MLS #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: Tony Felich
timelineItems.text: A HOCKEY GAME HAS BROKEN OUT IN SPORTING PARK. #SKCvNE #SportingKC

timelineItems.name: Sal Cipriano
timelineItems.text: Heck of an excellent game for a National Broadcast! #SKCvNE http://t.co/zg0r9vrNuw

timelineItems.comment: Attempt blocked. Lee Nguyen (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box is blocked. Assisted by Jermaine Jones.

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: Just a barrage of @SportingKC shots: http://t.co/jNuyUwmIrM #SKCvNE http://t.co/hRyMaQVEK7

timelineItems.name: BENJ…[ LOADING ]
timelineItems.text: I believe that Lee will Nguyen #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: Sporting's second-half resurgence apparently the result of a mysterious halftime visit from a cartoon rabbit holding a glowing soccer ball.

timelineItems.name: TinRo
timelineItems.text: #SKC fans are the best in the league! #MLS #Shots

timelineItems.name: BENJ…[ LOADING ]
timelineItems.text: The first half was much better for my heart than this second one has been. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: ThreeForAWin
timelineItems.text: Zero possession for the #NERevs this half. Fagundez should be in shortly. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Colson Tankersley
timelineItems.text: Lee Nguyen is kind of a beast. This MVP talk may be justified. @NERevolution #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Molly Haggerty
timelineItems.text: We scored! #sportingkc http://t.co/0OVyxijENO

timelineItems.name: Jared Bright
timelineItems.text: It's rally cap time at sporting park. #SKCNation #SKCvNE http://t.co/eJYTSi4ubJ

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: The Revs are in full-on freak out mode for no reason. They need to calm down & play their game. Got them 2-0 lead & now away from it #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Corner,  Sporting Kansas City. Conceded by Chris Tierney.
Attempt missed. Dominic Dwyer (Sporting Kansas City) header from the centre of the box misses to the left. Assisted by Graham Zusi with a cross following a corner.

timelineItems.name: Dan Clarke
timelineItems.text: This everybody chant is going to be with me all night #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: This game has another goal in it. And right now, it looks like #SportingKC is gonna get it. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: David Colgan
timelineItems.text: Graham Zusi is a quality player. Best player on the pitch by a long ways. #SportingKC

timelineItems.comment: Offside, Sporting Kansas City. Kevin Ellis tries a through ball, but Igor Julião is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Dan Clarke
timelineItems.text: 13 minutes to go and still level. Two subs left and gassed players. Hey I know, let's do nothing. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Soony Saad (Sporting Kansas City).
Kelyn Rowe (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Steve Brisendine
timelineItems.text: This game already has the "We don't like you and we want all three points" stamp all over it. In multiple layers and five colors of ink.

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: Heaps didn't sound happy about the non-call on Nguyen's fall near the box. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Will Northrup
timelineItems.text: Like the change. Neumann has impressed in this role. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Daniel Holt
timelineItems.text: Hello, Neumann! (I'm so, so sorry, everyone.) #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Justin Churchill
timelineItems.text: Heaps is so predictable... Always the same subs and formations. Honestly not a good thing #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Offside, New England Revolution. Lee Nguyen tries a through ball, but Kelyn Rowe is caught offside.

timelineItems.name: Daniel Holt
timelineItems.text: Even though it didn't work, that was a nice-looking play. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Austin Fido
timelineItems.text: Rowe wasn't offside. Should've been a penalty, if we're still playing the passive offside rules. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.desc: Goal!  Sporting Kansas City 2, New England Revolution 3. Jermaine Jones (New England Revolution) right footed shot from outside the box.
timelineItems.title: GOAL: Jermaine Jones skips in his first MLS goal

timelineItems.name: Brian O'Connell
timelineItems.text: Great defense by Alston. Bravo. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Total MLS
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones from distance! 3-2 New England. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Seth
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones. Worth every penny #nerevs

timelineItems.name: Ashleigh Ignelzi
timelineItems.text: Jermaine Jones with a stunna! #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Thayne Griffin
timelineItems.text: That was hideous. Poor defending and poor goalkeeping. #SKC

timelineItems.name: Major League Soccer
timelineItems.text: MY GOODNESS, JERMAINE JONES. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Johnny Boy
timelineItems.text: Nice goal by Jermaine Jones, but should’ve been saved. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Delay in match Igor Julião (Sporting Kansas City) because of an injury.
Delay over. They are ready to continue.

timelineItems.desc: Jose Goncalves gets booked for a hard foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Jose Goncalves clips Zusi from behind.

timelineItems.desc: Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City) is shown the yellow card for a bad foul.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Matt Besler chops down Davies from behind

timelineItems.comment: Foul by José Gonçalves (New England Revolution).
Graham Zusi (Sporting Kansas City) wins a free kick in the defensive half.

timelineItems.name: Matt LaPan
timelineItems.text: Early yellow on Kobayashi. Not a great play by Diago. Have to be smarter in this situation #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Brian Sparks
timelineItems.text: I though horse collar was a 15yrd penalty #SKC

timelineItems.name: Ian Lynch
timelineItems.text: Dear Santa, please bring Charlie Davis an extra large case of first touch for Christmas #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Slip Fizzlebeef
timelineItems.text: Glad to see we're already back to over the top through passes in an attempt to start some offense. Oi. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Jorge Claros (Sporting Kansas City).
Daigo Kobayashi (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the defensive half.
Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) wins a free kick in the attacking half.
Foul by Matt Besler (Sporting Kansas City).

timelineItems.name: Mo
timelineItems.text: Professional foul from JoGo #NERevs

timelineItems.name: BENJ…[ LOADING ]
timelineItems.text: Charlie, just go down when you get fouled. Don't pull your legs up under you. It looks bad. #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Sean Doyle
timelineItems.text: Hey Coach Vermes, now might be a good time to use those two subs you've got left on the bench. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Jasmond Madison
timelineItems.text: Who ever is on drums in the stadium is putting in work. Sounds like the last scene from "Drumline". #SKCvNE #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Teshawn Edmonds
timelineItems.text: Attendance at @SportingPark: 19,522 (51st successive sellout per @SKCgameday) #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: M. M. Murphy
timelineItems.text: Barnes on for Rowe... Just adding more defenders? #NERevs

timelineItems.name: Tiarra
timelineItems.text: 4 minutes ATTACKKKKKK #SKC

timelineItems.desc: Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) is shown the yellow card.
timelineItems.title: YELLOW CARD: Charlie Davies swings up a late boot

timelineItems.name: SKC Gameday
timelineItems.text: 90+3' Dwyer cuts into the middle from the right but Goncalves gets a big foot in to prevent the Englishman from shooting or passing. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.comment: Foul by Kevin Ellis (Sporting Kansas City).
Charlie Davies (New England Revolution) wins a free kick on the left wing.

timelineItems.name: Danielle ن
timelineItems.text: That was a slap to the face, but that was also a HUGE flop. #SKCvNE

timelineItems.name: Sporting Kansas City
timelineItems.text: FULL TIME: #SportingKC's frantic comeback falls short as the #NERevs earn a 3-2 victory @SportingPark.

timelineItems.name: Sam McDowell
timelineItems.text: That's it. New England 3, #SportingKC 2. The two teams are tied for second place in the Eastern Conference.

timelineItems.name: Fake Slyde
timelineItems.text: I have to say that thus far, I'm thoroughly enjoying the Jermaine Jones Era. #NERevs

timelineItems.comment: Second Half ends, Sporting Kansas City 2, New England Revolution 3.
